result.markdown:
--- title: "The dominance of coffee chains in worlds' coffee markets" author: "Xianghe" toc: true date: "2022-09-06" categories: [analysis, code] image: "map.jpg" ---
## Introduction Coffee is one of necessary in our everyday life. In every part of the world, in every culture, people drink coffee. Coffee is ubiquitous in modern society, it plays an vital role in our daily life; it gives people a good start of a day, providing energy to people throughout the work and study, inspiring people' mind and also enriching people' spare time. ![](image2.jpg){fig-align="center"} The history of coffee can be traced hundreds of years ago, and it is becoming a common refreshment drink spreading around the world. Some people with industrious minds recognizes this widespread appeal, and the more of the entrepreneurs uses the opportunity to make coffee a commodity and selling around the world so that they could profit from. Today, we can see coffee chain coffeehouses in every corner of the world, this are the fruits of coffee entrepreneurs' hard work and labor in the numerous coffee chains that have taken root worldwide. There are countless of coffee chains around the world, this post will only analyse three of main coffee chains in the world, which are Starbucks, Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts. The main focus of this post will be Starbucks and using Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts as supplementary to the analysis. We will take a close look at the coffee chain data in this post, especially the Starbucks and aim to see the distribution of coffee stores. In this post, the aim is that to find out whether coffee chain dominate in a coffee market also dominate other markets. ## Data Description The data is stored in a XLSX file and contains three set of coffee chain data, which corresponding to Starbucks, Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts respectively. __Starbucks, Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts__, which are three of main coffee chains in the world. The variables in each of coffee chain data set can be categorized into two groups; __the business store detail__ (store name, store number and store phone number etc) and __the geographical location information__ for each of coffeehouse (i.e. address, postcode, city, country, longitude and latitude etc).
The Starbucks data set contains __25600__ observations and __13__ variables, and it has included the Starbucks coffeehouses in __73__ countries. The Tim Hortons data set contains __4955__ observations and __6__ variables, and it contains only __2__ countries' coffeehouses data, which are USA and Canada. Similarly, the Dunkin' Donuts data set contains __4898__ observations and __22__ variables, and it contains only __1__ country' coffeehouses data, which is __USA__. ::: {.cell tbl-cap='_Dimension Table of the three coffee chainnn_'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Dimension Starbucks Tim.Hortons Dunkin..Donuts
No. Observation 25600 4955 4898
No. Varable 13 6 22
No. Country 73 2 1
````` ::: :::
From the data dimension table, it shows the Starbucks data set contains more observation of its coffeehouses and more worldwide compared with other two coffee chains Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts, where the data are limited to one or two countries. In this post, we will be more focused on the Starbucks coffee chain due to the limitation of the data of the other two coffee chain, Tim Hortons and Dunkin' Donuts. The data source is from Tidy Tuesday (Thomas Mock) [https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2018/2018-05-07](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2018/2018-05-07) . ## Data Story ![](image3.jpg){fig-align="center"} Despite of that the Starbucks data set contains the coffeehouses data over 73 countries, however, the Tim Hortons data set contains only USA and Canada coffeehouses data and the Dunkin' Donuts data set contains only the coffeehouses data in USA. This is the limitation of the data sets, and the only country that appears in each of the data set is USA. The United States of America (USA) is the world's third largest country in size and nearly the third largest in terms of population, and which means that its coffee market is large. So let's a look at these three coffee chain in USA. ::: {.cell .fig-cap-location-margin} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![__A comparison of popularity of the three coffee chains in USA__](index1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: The above plot shows the number of coffeehouses of the three coffee chains in USA. Starbucks has 13608 coffeehouses in USA, which is greater compared with Dunkin' Donuts and Tim Hortons (4898 and 740 coffeehouses respectively). This implies that although Starbucks, Tim Hortons and Dunkin's Donuts are all American-based coffee corporations, Starbucks is actually a more competitive coffee chain out of these three coffee chain.
We then take a look at the total number of Starbucks coffee houses in each of country. Due to there are __73__ countries, I only display the top 20 countries with highest number of Starbucks coffeehouses. ::: {.cell .fig-cap-location-margin} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` __Top 20 countries with highest number of Starbucks store__ ::: ::: As the graph illustrate above, the top 20 countries are USA, China, Canada, Japan, South Korea, United Kingdom, Mexico, Turkey, Philippines, Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia, Germany, United Arab Emirates, France, Singapore, Russia, Argentina and Kuwait, and the countries are ordered from highest to lowest according to number of Starbucks coffeehouse in the country.
The graph also shows that USA has highest total number of Starbucks coffeehouses among all the countries worldwide, the number of the coffeehouses in USA is far more than other countries' (USA has 13608 coffeehouses). However, despite of extreme high value of number of coffeehouses, this is expected and can be understood; Starbucks Corporation is an American based multinational chain of coffeehouses and headquartered in Seattle, Washington. Also, USA is one of economic dominant countries in the world, and the it has the capacity and the potential to absorb a high number of coffeehouses. So Starbucks has the ground to expand many coffeehouses in USA.
Interestingly, Australia is not listed on the graph above! This is a bit of unusual and unexpected, since Australia is the 6-th largest country in the world, and is 12th largest economy in the world.(IMF, 2022) According to industry statistics, there are 24,929 Cafes and Coffee Shops businesses in Australia as of 2022.(IBIS World, 2022) Indeed, Australia has a big coffee market and Australian market should be one of the global strategies for the coffee chains like Starbucks. ::: {.cell tbl-cap='_Total of Starbucks stores in Australia_'} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Country Total
AU 22
````` ::: ::: The table indicates that there are only __22__ of Starbucks existed in Australia nationwide.
::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell .fig-cap-location-margin} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![__Comparison of starbucks stores between USA and Australia, by states__](index1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
The above plot makes a comparison of number of Starbucks store between countries Australia and USA. The left side of the plot displays the Australian states which have Starbucks and the number of Starbucks store within the state, it shows that there are only three states in Australia which have Starbucks and each of state has less than 10 Starbucks stores. This creates a distinct contrast with the plot on the right, where the each state in USA has hundreds and thousands of Starbucks stores.
From the plot, there are hundreds and thousands of Starbucks coffeehouses in each state of USA, this indicates that Starbucks is a giant and dominant coffee chain in coffee chains industry in USA. However, it would not be the case in Australia, Starbucks is performing poorly in occupying Australian coffee market, where there are only 22 Starbucks coffeehouses nationwide, out of around 25,000 cafes in Australia.
## Conclusion By comparing the number of Starbucks coffee stores in Australia and USA, despite of the fact that Starbucks is a competitive coffee chain in USA coffee market, it is not taking much portion of the Australian market. Hence, a conclusion can be drawn on that a global coffee chain may be playing a dominant role in a coffee market, but it may not able to be a dominant coffee chain in another coffee market globally. ## Reference Thomas Mock (2022). Tidy Tuesday: A weekly data project aimed at the R ecosystem. https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday. IMF (2022). World Economic Outlook Update: War sets back the global recovery. https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/WEO/Issues/2022/04/19/world-economic-outlook-april-2022 IBIS World (2022). Industry Statistics Australia: Cafes and Coffee Shops in Australia - Number of Businesses 2007–2028. https://www.ibisworld.com/au/number-of-businesses/cafes-coffee-shops/2015/#:~:text=There%20are%2024%2C929%20Cafes%20and,increase%20of%204.5%25%20from%202021. Hao Zhu (2021). kableExtra: Construct Complex Table with 'kable' and Pipe Syntax. R package version 1.3.4. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=kableExtra H. Wickham. ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis. Springer-Verlag New York, 2016. Hadley Wickham and Jennifer Bryan (2022). readxl: Read Excel Files.
